item.title: [DISTRELEC-6862] DE - Remove order note @checkout step 3

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6857] CH - VAT-ID should not be mandatory
item.description:

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6846] Remove JavaMelody again
item.description:
Hi Nabil

I think all the data collected by JavaMelody is now available in Zabbix. Do you agree to remove JavaMelody again?
If yes, can you do this, please? Low prio task.

Cheers, Adrian

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Hi Adi,
Yes I agree to remove it since no one is really using it.

/Nabil.
Oender, do you know if someone is using JavaMelody Monitoring interface ?
Hi Nabil, from my end we don't use JavaMelody. Also I'm not Aware that someone is using it. Br, Önder
After checking the access logs on the webservers, it seems that no one is using it. So, I will remove it.
fixed.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6832] Optimize response time of homepage
item.description:
The response time of the homepage is currently 1.0 second (avg).
This can be reduced by adding an additional oscache for the home content area.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Implemented. Response time to be analyzed as soon as v3.3.5 is available on the systems.
Successfully tested on Q-System. Response time was around 150-200ms.
Status: Caching is too aggressive. Price information on the homepage are user dependent and also channel (B2B/B2C) dependent. I have to change the caching key.
Fixed.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6641] SEO - Url Rewriting - Optimization - Sitemaps Integration
item.description:
Observations :

  • Our Url rewriting is going to be optimized.
  • The sitemap are generating list of rewrited urls independantly to the rewrite module of hybris.
  • The sitemaps must contain final destination url (no redirections).

Demands :

  • Implement the new url rewriting rules inside the sitemaps.
  • Do not deploy on P url rewritting optimization without sitemap corrected rewritting.

Checking process :

  • Need to be verify locally by PHUBERT
  • This issue can't be closed without my final live check.
  • Thank you to update the status of the implementation in the comment below.
item.summary: SEO - Url Rewriting - Optimization - Sitemaps Integration

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Please check on the DEV system ( http://dev.distrelec-ch.distrelec.com/sitemap_index.xml )
checked here http://jira.distrelec.com/browse/DISTRELEC-6547?focusedCommentId=38085&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-38085
Status?!

Pierre is checking on DEV System.

Note: all tickets related to SEO, are fixed on DEV.
Please check on DEV.

rewriting correctly implemented inside sitemaps.
Ready for P
Has been deployed to Q - Please test, thanks.

Hi,
I discovered an issue in the sitemap generation. I already fixed it and will be deployment with v3.4.0.

Can you send me CH Q sitemap ?
(we can't send them on prod without a full verification.)
I made some bug fixing and some optimizations. My changes will be available in the next version.

Please provide them to me, we don't go live on sitemap without a check.
thx.
According to Rafael Burlet, the next Q deployment ( v3.4.0 ) will be on Friday 22.05.2015 at 15:00.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5858] Do not display empty categories / "Hiding" of empty categories
item.description:
As we have a very dynamic range of products, we have every now and then the case that categories are empty (be it because they have been deleted, all the articles are currently unavailable, etc).

In any case, these empty categories should never be displayed on the shop. So please implement a mechanism that hides empty categories so that they are not displayed anymore as long as they are empty.
item.summary: Do not display empty categories / "Hiding" of empty categories

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Hi Raphi
Do you see any way to do this?
I think this won't be possible as lomg the mega flyout is a static element.

This is not possible. The only thing that we can do is that we check with a cronjob if there are categories that do not contain any products.
Please check that with Adi especially in point of performance.

Hi Adi,
do you have any idea to solve this?

Hi Daniela

I implemented the following logic:

When you would open this category http://www.distrelec.ch/de/Computer-%26-Hobby/Freizeit-und-Hobby/Sicherheit-%C3%9Cberwachung/c/cat-L3D_542673 with no product results inside, there would be a redirect to its super category http://www.distrelec.ch/de/Computer-%26-Hobby/Freizeit-und-Hobby/c/cat-L2D_542669.

This logic is working but I didnt commit yet. Would you like that I do this change? What about SEO? Are there any conflicts with this behaviour?

Cheers
Will

@Will : The logic have already been implemented here : http://jira.distrelec.com/browse/DISTRELEC-5960
Please read the tiquet and check with Francesco how to modify it to be available not only for bots but also for users.

Pierre
committed in v3.2. ready for test deployment.
Please test today, thx.

On my side it's ok.

Question : Who is in charge of the maintenance of the "super category pages" ?
The empy cat are redirected but, their empty links need to be removed too, exemple for
http://test.distrelec.ch/de/Computer-%26-Hobby/Freizeit-und-Hobby/c/cat-L2D_542669

Hi Pierre

There is a dedicated workflow for this: http://my.datwyler.biz/t/distrelec/inclusion-initiatives_projects/process/webclass/Pages/Home.aspx
If you ever have any changes, please refer to this.

In this specific case, it shows that the issue has not been really fixed, as we still display empty categories.
Please put remaining estimate for the fix.
As discussed, create new flag "doNotDispalyInFE" on category. Set flag to true by redirect action. Activate "dead" categories by a cronjob, which checks all deactivated categories once a month.
@Will : Since the fluctuation/bugs are quite frequent, if it's not too resources demanding, is it possible to run the cronjob every weeks ?

Hi Pierre

I we can do testing on Q, when I have implemented the job.

Cheers
Will
Perfect, let's do this.
committed in trunk. Ready for Q deployment.
Deployed on Q. We can test the new functionality together.
Has been deployed to Q - Please test, thanks.

It almost works. The unavailable octagons disappear when clicked on, however, the side navigation stays. So the problem remains. And like this, it's even more confusing for the customer as it's not clear what's happening. You do not know if you are deeper in the navigation or if you are confronted with a bug.

/Daniela

I will solve the bug for the side navigation and I will show you how the cronjobs are working etc. tomorrow.

Cheers
Will
Fixed the bug for the side navigation. Ready for Q deployment.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4558] SEO - URL Migration Issues - HTTP Redirect 302 to change into 301
item.description:
Observations :

  • Several url pattern of the previous and current website are redirected with 302 http status, exemples :
    • old website product url pattern
      https://www.distrelec.ch/kleinsign-diode-do-35-75-v/diotec/1n4148/603016 & http://www.distrelec.ch/kleinsign-diode-do-35-75-v/diotec/1n4148/603016
      -302> http://www.distrelec.ch/p/603016
      -302> http://www.distrelec.ch/fr/Diodes-SMD-DO-35-75-V-Diotec-1N4148/p/17000557 (200)
    • old website family url pattern
      https://www.distrelec.ch/silizium-kleinsignaldioden/diotec/1n-4-bav
      -302> http://www.distrelec.ch/silizium-kleinsignaldioden/diotec/1n-4-bav (404) (to implement with https://jira.namics.com/browse/DISTRELEC-4597 3.1)
      We need :
      https://www.distrelec.ch/silizium-kleinsignaldioden/diotec/1n-4-bav -301> http://www.distrelec.ch/de/Komponenten/Aktive-Bauelemente/Diskrete-Halbleiter-R%C3%B6hren/Dioden/Kleinsignaldioden/Silizium-Kleinsignaldioden/c/cat-15514
    • old website home redirect :
      http://www.distrelec.ch/home/de
      -302> http://www.distrelec.ch/?lang=de (404)
    • old website ssl redirect :
      https://www.distrelec.ch/*
      -302> http://www.distrelec.ch/* (200)
    • new website product dynamic rewriting url pattern
      http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Axial-fan-DC-120-x-120-x-38-mm-24-VDC-Sunon-PMD2412PMB1-A-2-GN/p/15413483 -302> http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Axial-fan-DC-120-x-120-x-38-mm-24-VDC-Sunon-PMD2412PMB1-A-%282%29-GN/p/15413483
      http://www.distrelec.ch/p/11046101 -302> http://www.distrelec.ch/de/Philips-AJ7034D---Radiouhr-mit-Apple-Dock-Cradle-Philips-AJ7034D-12/p/11046101
      http://www.distrelec.ch/*/p/11046101 -302> http://www.distrelec.ch/de/Philips-AJ7034D---Radiouhr-mit-Apple-Dock-Cradle-Philips-AJ7034D-12/p/11046101
    • new website https to http dynamic rewriting url pattern
      https://www.distrelec.ch/en/Automation/Wireless-Communication/GPS/c/cat-L3D_525576
      -302> http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Automation/Wireless-Communication/GPS/c/cat-L3D_525576 (200)
      ...

Impacts :

  • In SEO, to transmit the potential of a webpage to another one, we must use redirection with the http status code 301.
  • The current 302 redirection don't transfer any "Page Weight" to the redirected pages, resulting into a failed migration on those multiple faulty pattern.

Demands :

  • All the 302 redirect rules inside the distrelec.ch .htaccess must be transformed into 301 redirect,
  • All the 302 redirect rules inside the distrelec.ch automatized url rewriting scripts or router (if existing) outside the .htaccess must be transformed into 301 redirect,
  • All the upcoming redirection to do must be in 301 status,
  • Exception for maintenance pages, they need a 503 in the header when active.

Checking process :

  • This issue can't be closed without my final live check.
  • Thank you to update the status of the implementation in the comment below.
item.summary: SEO - URL Migration Issues - HTTP Redirect 302 to change into 301

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Live check :

  • http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Diode-DO-35-75-V-Diotec-1N4148/p/17000557 -301> http://www.distrelec.ch/p/603016 -302> http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Diode-DO-35-75-V-Diotec-1N4148/p/17000557 : NOK
  • old website family url pattern : 301 NOK
  • old website home redirect : 301 NOK
  • old website ssl redirect : 301 NOK
  • new website product dynamic rewriting url pattern : 301 NOK
  • new website https to http dynamic rewriting url pattern : 301 NOK

=> Reopening of the issue.

Live check :

  • http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Diode-DO-35-75-V-Diotec-1N4148/p/17000557 -301> http://www.distrelec.ch/p/603016 -301> http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Diode-DO-35-75-V-Diotec-1N4148/p/17000557 : OK
  • old website family url pattern : 301 NOK
  • old website home redirect : 301 OK
  • old website ssl redirect : 301 NOK
  • new website product dynamic rewriting url pattern : 301 OK
  • new website https to http dynamic rewriting url pattern : 301 NOK

• old website ssl redirect : 301 NOK
  • new website https to http dynamic rewriting url pattern : 301 NOK

For SSL there is a core problem on Hybris itself.
We have to clarify with Hybris.
Is this really such a impotant point? Should we start with this process?
Yes this is a critical point.

Live check :

  • old website family url pattern : 301 NOK
  • old website ssl redirect : 301 NOK
  • new website https to http dynamic rewriting url pattern : 301 NOK
Problem solved with the https robots.txt

When we have a redirection from the rewritting router with a query string inside the url, the http status is 302.
Please correct it to be in 301 since we are optimizaing the rewritting and Billions of url will be concerned and need to be migrated correctly.

It's a blocker for the current deployment
I updated all 302 redirection to 301. This includes Products, Categories and Manufacturers.

great news !
Thx for the speed

It's on dev/Q ?

I merged the changes back to trunk and deployed them, so you can test it on DEV now.
Example: http://dev.distrelec-ch.distrelec.com/p/101010.
It's ok on dev !
